A.|last3=Xie|first3=D.|last4=Rambaut|first4=A.|title=Bayesian Phylogenetics with BEAUti and the BEAST 1.7|journal=Molecular Biology and Evolution|volume=29|issue=8|year=2012|pages=1969–1973|issn=0737-4038|doi=10.1093/molbev/mss075|pmid=22367748|pmc=3408070}}</ref> <ref name="FitzJohn2012">{{cite journal|last1=FitzJohn|first1=Richard G.|title=Diversitree: comparative phylogenetic analyses of diversification in R|journal=Methods in Ecology and Evolution|volume=3|issue=6|year=2012|pages=1084–1092|issn=2041-210X|doi=10.1111/j.2041-210X.2012.00234.x}}</ref> <ref name="Pagel1994">{{cite journal|last1=Pagel|first1=M.|title=Detecting Correlated Evolution on Phylogenies: A General Method for the Comparative Analysis of Discrete Characters|journal=Proceedings of the Royal Society B: Biological Sciences|volume=255|issue=1342|year=1994|pages=37–45|issn=0962-8452|doi=10.1098/rspb.1994.0006}}</ref> <ref name="YuHarris2010">{{cite journal|last1=Yu|first1=Yan|last2=Harris|first2=A.J.|last3=He|first3=Xingjin|title=S-DIVA (Statistical Dispersal-Vicariance Analysis): A tool for inferring biogeographic histories|journal=Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution|volume=56|issue=2|year=2010|pages=848–850|issn=1055-7903|doi=10.1016/j.ympev.2010.04.011|pmid=20399277}}</ref> <ref name="AriasSzumik2011">{{cite journal|last1=Arias|first1=J. Salvador|last2=Szumik|first2=Claudia A.|last3=Goloboff|first3=Pablo A.|title=Spatial analysis of vicariance: a method for using direct geographical information in historical biogeography|journal=Cladistics|volume=27|issue=6|year=2011|pages=617–628|issn=0748-3007|doi=10.1111/j.1096-0031.2011.00353.x}}</ref> <ref name="JonesRajaraman2012">{{cite journal|last1=Jones|first1=B. R.|last2=Rajaraman|first2=A.|last3=Tannier|first3=E.|last4=Chauve|first4=C.|title=ANGES: reconstructing ANcestral GEnomeS maps|journal=Bioinformatics|volume=28|issue=18|year=2012|pages=2388–2390|issn=1367-4803|doi=10.1093/bioinformatics/bts457|pmid=22820205}}</ref> <ref name="LargetKadane2005">{{cite journal|last1=Larget|first1=Bret|last2=Kadane|first2=Joseph B.|last3=Simon|first3=Donald L.|title=A Bayesian approach to the estimation of ancestral genome arrangements|journal=Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution|volume=36|issue=2|year=2005|pages=214–223|issn=1055-7903|doi=10.1016/j.ympev.2005.03.026|pmid=15893477}}</ref> <ref name="Csuos2010">{{cite journal|last1=Csuos|first1=M.|title=Count: evolutionary analysis of phylogenetic profiles with parsimony and likelihood|journal=Bioinformatics|volume=26|issue=15|year=2010|pages=1910–1912|issn=1367-4803|doi=10.1093/bioinformatics/btq315|pmid=20551134}}</ref> <ref name="CarmelWolf2010">{{cite journal|last1=Carmel|first1=Liran|last2=Wolf|first2=Yuri I.|last3=Rogozin|first3=Igor B.|last4=Koonin|first4=Eugene V.|title=EREM: Parameter Estimation and Ancestral Reconstruction by Expectation-Maximization Algorithm for a Probabilistic Model of Genomic Binary Characters Evolution|journal=Advances in Bioinformatics|volume=2010|year=2010|pages=1–4|issn=1687-8027|doi=10.1155/2010/167408}}</ref> <ref name="PatroSefer2012">{{cite journal|last1=Patro|first1=Rob|last2=Sefer|first2=Emre|last3=Malin|first3=Justin|last4=Marçais|first4=Guillaume|last5=Navlakha|first5=Saket|last6=Kingsford|first6=Carl|title=Parsimonious reconstruction of network evolution|journal=Algorithms for Molecular Biology|volume=7|issue=1|year=2012|pages=25|issn=1748-7188|doi=10.1186/1748-7188-7-25}}</ref> <ref name="DialloMakarenkov2009">{{cite journal|last1=Diallo|first1=A. B.|last2=Makarenkov|first2=V.|last3=Blanchette|first3=M.|title=Ancestors 1.0: a web server for ancestral sequence reconstruction|journal=Bioinformatics|volume=26|issue=1|year=2009|pages=130–131|issn=1367-4803|doi=10.1093/bioinformatics/btp600|pmid=19850756}}</ref> <ref name="AshkenazyPenn2012">{{cite journal|last1=Ashkenazy|first1=H.|last2=Penn|first2=O.|last3=Doron-Faigenboim|first3=A.|last4=Cohen|first4=O.|last5=Cannarozzi|first5=G.|last6=Zomer|first6=O.|last7=Pupko|first7=T.|title=FastML: a web server for probabilistic reconstruction of ancestral sequences|journal=Nucleic Acids Research|volume=40|issue=W1|year=2012|pages=W580–W584|issn=0305-1048|doi=10.1093/nar/gks498|pmid=22661579|pmc=3394241}}</ref> <ref name="HuLin2014">{{cite journal|last1=Hu|first1=Fei|last2=Lin|first2=Yu|last3=Tang|first3=Jijun|title=MLGO: phylogeny reconstruction and ancestral inference from gene-order data|journal=BMC Bioinformatics|volume=15|issue=1|year=2014|issn=1471-2105|doi=10.1186/s12859-014-0354-6|pmid=25376663|pmc=4236499}}</ref> <ref name="BouchardCoteJordan2012">{{cite journal|last1=Bouchard-Cote|first1=A.|last2=Jordan|first2=M. I.|title=Evolutionary inference via the Poisson Indel Process|journal=Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences|volume=110|issue=4|year=2012|pages=1160–1166|issn=0027-8424|doi=10.1073/pnas.1220450110|pmid=23275296|pmc=3557041|arxiv=1207.6327|bibcode=2013PNAS..110.1160B}}</ref> <ref name="ThorneKishino1991">{{cite journal|last1=Thorne|first1=Jeffrey L.|last2=Kishino|first2=Hirohisa|last3=Felsenstein|first3=Joseph|title=An evolutionary model for maximum likelihood alignment of DNA sequences|journal=Journal of Molecular Evolution|volume=33|issue=2|year=1991|pages=114–124|issn=0022-2844|doi=10.1007/BF02193625|bibcode=1991JMolE..33..114T}}</ref> <ref name="FraserPoon2012">{{cite journal|last1=Fraser|first1=Christophe|last2=Poon|first2=Art F. Y.|last3=Swenson|first3=Luke C.|last4=Bunnik|first4=Evelien M.|last5=Edo-Matas|first5=Diana|last6=Schuitemaker|first6=Hanneke|last7=van 't Wout|first7=Angélique B.|last8=Harrigan|first8=P. Richard|title=Reconstructing the Dynamics of HIV Evolution within Hosts from Serial Deep Sequence Data|journal=PLoS Computational Biology|volume=8|issue=11|year=2012|pages=e1002753|issn=1553-7358|doi=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1002753|pmid=23133358|pmc=3486858|bibcode=2012PLSCB...8E2753P}}</ref> <ref name="BeerenwinkelSchwarz2014">{{cite journal|last1=[[Niko Beerenwinkel|Beerenwinkel]]|first1=Niko|last2=Schwarz|first2=Roland F.|last3=Trinh|first3=Anne|last4=Sipos|first4=Botond|last5=Brenton|first5=James D.|last6=Goldman|first6=Nick|last7=Markowetz|first7=Florian|title=Phylogenetic Quantification of Intra-tumour Heterogeneity|journal=PLoS Computational Biology|volume=10|issue=4|year=2014|pages=e1003535|issn=1553-7358|doi=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1003535|arxiv=1306.1685|bibcode=2014PLSCB..10E3535S}}</ref> <ref name="HubiszPollard2010">{{cite journal|last1=Hubisz|first1=M. J.|last2=Pollard|first2=K. S.|last3=Siepel|first3=A.|title=PHAST and RPHAST: phylogenetic analysis with space/time models|journal=Briefings in Bioinformatics|volume=12|issue=1|year=2010|pages=41–51|issn=1467-5463|doi=10.1093/bib/bbq072|pmc=3030812}}</ref> }}

revision.comment: /* top */HTTP to HTTPS for [[Findlaw]], replaced: http://blogs.findlaw.com/ → https://blogs.findlaw.com/ using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{globalize|date=December 2010}}
'''Attorney misconduct''' is unethical or illegal conduct by an attorney. Attorney Misconduct may include: [[conflict of interest]], over billing, refusing to represent a client for political or professional motives, false or misleading statements, hiding evidence, abandoning a client, failing to disclose all relevant facts, arguing a position while neglecting to disclose prior law which might counter the argument, and'' in some instances'' having sex with a client.
The advent of electronic record keeping and "e-discovery" has also resulted in a record number of attorney sanctions for a range of abuses from failure to produce to the leaking of sealed documents.<ref>[https://blogs.findlaw.com/strategist/2011/01/attorney-e-discovery-sanctions-at-all-time-high.html Attorney E-Discovery Sanctions At All-Time High], FindLaw blog, January 20, 2011.</ref> In a case highlighting such abuses, in 2007 plaintiff's in a pharmaceutical lawsuit were found to conspire with attorneys and journalists to publicize protected discovery documents defying a judge's [[protective order]].<ref>[http://www.wlf.org/upload/042707womeldorf.pdf When conspirators defy protective orders], Washington Legal Foundation, April 27, 2007.</ref>
As the Durham County, North Carolina prosecutor, [[Mike Nifong]], gained national infamy for a pattern of '''attorney misconduct''' related to the [[2006 Duke University lacrosse team scandal]].
[[Legal malpractice]] is a separate concept such as when an attorney fails to adequately, professionally, competently, or zealously represent a client. While malpractice and misconduct may often be found in the same matter, they are separate concepts and need not both exist.
==Codification of rules and enforcement==
The [[American Bar Association]] (ABA) has established model rules of professional conduct expected of attorneys, which most states in the U.S. have incorporated as part of their state laws. Each state issues its own set of rules governing the ethical rules and the related enforcement of those rules, generally through their state [[bar association]]s. As the state bar organizations and their enforcement mechanisms are composed of lawyers who set the rules, the regulation of attorney ethics is [[Industry self-regulation|self regulated and self policed]]. The self-regulation of any industry by its economic participants poses an inherent [[conflict of interest]] between the professional objectives of the members of the profession and those for whom the regulation would protect. Some academic researchers and industry pundits have asserted that attorney discipline in the U.S. is ineffective,<ref>Leslie C. Levin, The Emperor's Clothes and Other Tales About the Standards for Imposing Lawyer Discipline Sanctions, 48 American University Law Review 1 (1998).</ref><ref>Paula A. Monopoli, Legal Ethics and Practical Politics: Musings on the Public Perception of Lawyer Discipline, 10 Geo. J. Legal Ethics 423, 425 (1997)</ref> and favors lawyers and law firms.<ref>William T. Gallagher, "Ideologies of Professionalism and the Politics of Self-Regulation in the California State Bar," 22 Pepp. L. Rev. 485, 490-491.(1995)</ref>
Individual lawyers or their firms may be cited for misconduct by a judge in the originating proceedings or by a corresponding state bar.
==Notes and references== <references/>
==External Links & Articles== *[[American Bar Association]] *[[American Bar Association Model Rules of Professional Conduct]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Attorney Misconduct}} [[Category:Legal ethics]] [[Category:Misconduct]] [[Category:Professional ethics]]
{{Miscarriage of Justice}}
